result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly R Grutzik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: A six month commitment order will be imposed, due to non-payment and is to run consecutive to any sentence defendant may be serving at that time.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 2:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug appeared by video for Kelly R Grutzik. Defendant Kelly R Grutzik in court. State resolution - defendant would plead guilty to amended count 1 possession of cocaine as party to crime, with a $500 fine plus costs. Count 2 would be DRI. Fahrenkrug and Grutzik agree. Court questions if PLQ was filed. Fahrenkrug indicates issue with count 2 on State's Settlement recommendation, can upload now if court is willing to wait. Off record, 2:09 PM. Back on the record, 2:13 PM. Court makes sure that the defendant understands what it means to have a count DRI. Grutzik understands. Court amends count 1 to possession of cocaine with modifier of party to a crime. Grutzik pleads guilty to amended count one. Court goes over PLQ, finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea, waiving her constitutional rights and right to trial. Court finds factual basis exists, accepts plea of guilty to count one as amended with party to crime allegation. State makes statement, minimal criminal history and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Fahrenkrug makes final statement, has completed AODA and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Grutzik makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts all statement of parties, has considered all sentencing factors and will follow joint recommendation, sentences defendant to count 1 - $500 fine plus costs, grants 60 DTP/CO. DNA sample with surcharge. Appeal rights given.
Attached is proof of why she did not receive the bond in the mail in time to sign it and get it back to the COC Office within 10 days as ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:32 PM Defendant Kelly R Grutzik in court with attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kelly R Grutzik appeared by video means with Attorney. State - recently advised that the PH is being waived. Defendant and attorney agree, did go over the waiver of PH form but did not upload it. Court does verbal waiver of right to PH collaquy, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelliently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Defense counsel has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas. Court accepts plea, notices that the signature bond has not been signed and retuned - defendant states she never received it but will stop in this week by Friday at 4:30 to sign it, Court will continue bond then, set for JT, if resolved - contact JA for PLEAS, defendant must appear in person for any future hearings. Defense counsel is willing to set a PLEAS date. State stiill needs to send discovery. Court will set for PLEAS on 5/25/22 at 2:00 PM, counsel to be here for the plea as well as the defendant. After further discussion, if the defendant does not have an objection to counsel appearing via Zoom for the PLEAS, counsel is allowed to appear via Zoom but defendant must still be in person. Parties understand.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Must sign and return to Clerk of Court within 10 days
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:24 AM Defendant Kelly R Grutzik appears by video with attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug appearing by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video.  CC and CR appear by video. Fahrenkug has went over the complaint with Grutizik, waives formal reading and asks for PH to be set, willing to waive time limits. Court consider time limits waived for PH. State asks for $500 signature bond. Court sets $250 signature bond, must sign and return with in 10 days. PH set for 4/6/22 at 1:30 PM.
